data.name: Rats in a Cage
data.detailed_description:
A greedy CEO of your company has tasked you to hack Santa’s computer to change everyone’s Christmas wishes to the company's discount coupons. But the computer is protected by a very rude AI that is not afraid to cross any line to stop you.

In a series of single-room puzzles created by the AI, both your intellect and your morality will be tested. As a typical corporate rat you’ll have to figure out how to take credit for work you didn’t do, take advantage of your coworkers, manipulate and sacrifice them for your own gain, and lose all your remaining dignity to get to that secret list that will make your boss rich. Or maybe not.

Coffee will naturally play an important role. And who knows? Maybe you’ll even attend one of those endless meetings or climb the corporate ladder by sucking up to your boss. Just like in any corporation, you’ll have to endure a lot. The AI won’t hesitate to demoralize you any chance it’ll get.

Key Features

  • 60 puzzles and 5 riddles
  • Gameplay mechanics that go beyond the game window
  • Love-hate relationship between the game and its player
  • Absurd world of corporate bull**itting and sucking up
  • 4+ hours of playtime
  • Ridiculous achievements

Features

--Manipulate coworkers with a coffee--


Every corporate rat loves coffee. There's nothing more important! Whenever they have a chance to get one, they'll run towards it. You can move coworkers where you want them to be by giving them access to a coffee.



--Get rid of responsibility--


Too much work to do? Yeah we've been there. Postponing work is always a way to go. You can always pretend you've never received the email, assign it to someone else or act like you're extremely busy



--Spread gossip to manipulate coworkers--


Who doesn't love a juicy gossip in the office? Everyone wants to know who's getting fired and who's having a romance. Best part is - you can spread gossip anywhere!



--Get promoted to the next floor--


Corporation doesn't want you to move forward.
Corporation doesn't want to give you more money.
Corporation doesn't want you to get a promotion.
But you can surely fight for it. Did I say fight? I meant being humilated for it.



--Pay the price for hints--

C O M I N G S O O N

data.short_description: A darkly funny puzzle game with a unique relationship with its player. As a typical corporate rat, you’ll have to manipulate and sacrifice your coworkers and take credit for a work you didn’t do in order to beat a very rude AI that knows who you are and what you are up to.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8, 10
  • Processor: Intel Pentium III 800 MHz
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Graphics: 1024x768 High Color +
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: OS X 10.6.8
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 capable graphics card
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
